unit.utterance: hajʁib caw karispendent kːazatla Tawluj ce barq'ij heχ
unit.utterance_translation: (One time) a journalist from a newspaper came here to write about Tawlu [lit. to do this about Tawlu],

unit.utterance: statja belk'unne kak peredowiklij.
unit.utterance_translation: to write an article about the one who is the best [as a farmer].

unit.utterance: nu belk'un cab qːuʁace statja heχil ħaˁdur barq'ib cab čum sotok, čum gektar, ce birq'ulde
unit.utterance_translation: Well, he wrote a beautiful article, he prepared how many hectares, how many hectares, what [Tawlu] did.

unit.utterance: cet'le perewodik agurde lidil cik'al.
unit.utterance_translation: How he became the best, everything.

unit.utterance: nu ixʷle hercːud ik'ul caw q'anne gur waxud helij čut čut tam... [CROSSTALK]
unit.utterance_translation: "Well, I get up early, I lay down late," he says, about it, a bit there.

unit.utterance: c'il familija ik'ulcaw heχicːe iχ.
unit.utterance_translation: Then he tells him his surname.

unit.utterance: iχ Tawlu ik'ul žaˁparow.
unit.utterance_translation: Tawlu tells him Zhaparov.

unit.utterance: imja Tawlu.
unit.utterance_translation: And given name Tawlu.

unit.utterance: otčestwo Tawluewič,
unit.utterance_translation: Patronym Tawluevich.

unit.utterance: heχ q'uc' ʡaˁsi iχuble caw dukaltːi kerħaˁn caw ik'ul žaˁndaruw Tawlu Tawluewič belk'unnede.
unit.utterance_translation: He [the journalist] got angry and thought that he [Tawlu] made a joke, and wrote [in the article] Zhandaruv Tawlu Tawluevich.
unit.add_comments: Kumyk people call Dargi people Zhandar. Dargi people call Kumyk people Tawlu.

unit.utterance: Tawlu žaˁndaruwič belk'unnede.
unit.utterance_translation: [No], (he) wrote Tawlu Zhandarovich.

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] caw qːumuqlandew?
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] Was he himself Kumyk?

unit.utterance: aʔa, darkːʷande.
unit.utterance_translation: No, he was Dargi.

unit.utterance: c'il warčːible hel wstreča barq'ible helicːella.
unit.utterance_translation: Then (Tawlu) found (him), they met up with him.

unit.utterance: cellij ik'ulde heχʁuna barq'ibde ul?
unit.utterance_translation: "Why did you say it like this, why did you do this?"

unit.utterance: cellij oskorbit warq'ibde admila gal?
unit.utterance_translation: "Why did you insult a person?"
unit.add_comments: DF: "gal" means 'child' (or maybe 'son', 'boy') in other Dargi varieties.

unit.utterance: tuda-sjuda.
unit.utterance_translation: Back and forth.

unit.utterance: waħ cinni ik'ʷar du ce warq'ible dul cel awarq'anne caw?
unit.utterance_translation: "Wah, he's done this to me," (the journalist) says, "why should I not do this?"

unit.utterance: pasport čiwažaqible izwinitsja iχub c'il.
unit.utterance_translation: (Tawlu) showed his passport (to the journalist), and then that (journalist) said sorry.

unit.utterance: du ʡaˁsi iχubda ik'ʷar, heχ Tawlu bik'ʷanqːella ik'ʷar.
unit.utterance_translation: "I got angry," he says, "when you said this, Tawlu," he says.

unit.utterance: nacijonalist gursajčible hel.
unit.utterance_translation: That [journalist] was a nationalist.

unit.utterance: helʁuna t'amahama agurtede Tawlulara heχilara.
unit.utterance_translation: A story like this happened to Tawlu and him.

unit.utterance: heχ Tawlula har zamana dirχʷar t'amahama.
unit.utterance_translation: With Tawlu such stories always happen.

unit.utterance: [INTERVIEWER TALK]
unit.utterance_translation: [INTERVIEWER TALK]

unit.utterance: heštːu belk'ʷij bikːuldew at?
unit.utterance_translation: Do you want to record [lit. write] it here?

unit.utterance: [INTERVIEWER TALK]
unit.utterance_translation: [INTERVIEWER TALK]

unit.utterance: nu šest... lidilra ʡuˁmru ʁanu urekːra dusː tolko rabotal.
unit.utterance_translation: Well six, all my life, 26 years I only worked.

unit.utterance: ʁanu aʁʷra-xura dusː dalnobojšikom
unit.utterance_translation: 24, 25 years as as a lorry driver.

unit.utterance: libillicːerka bah qːuʁace dunja kabicːuril dam dejstwitelno Latwijade.
unit.utterance_translation: Among all the most beautiful (country) in the world seemed to me Latvia.

unit.utterance: Latwija, Estonija... [CROSSTALK] kːalkme duqente
unit.utterance_translation: Latvia, Estonia,... tall trees.

unit.utterance: c'idex wac'acːed kusa dikːuldel.
unit.utterance_translation: Fruit in the forests however much you wanted.

unit.utterance: c'aq'le balbičib musːa.
unit.utterance_translation: (Latvia was) a very fitting [= good] place.

unit.utterance: i xun,... amzudex, krasota, xunra
unit.utterance_translation: And the roads, order, beauty, and the roads!

unit.utterance: hetːu wituqunqːella Latwijalcːe plitačnyj xunbe, dam hanbičib na libil mašin dila parapara habirkanne ik'ul
unit.utterance_translation: When I arrived there in Latvia, there were slabbed roads, I remember now, my car made 'parapara' (= sound),

unit.utterance: čikabarc'ur xunne šik-šik t'amacːella wabše laˁʁunce awadance xun.
unit.utterance_translation: (My car) stuck to the road with a shikshik sound, it went very well without problem.

unit.utterance: hak'bulqunne akːʷi mašina
unit.utterance_translation: The car did not shake.

unit.utterance: šaharricːed swetaforte dakːʷi.
unit.utterance_translation: In the towns there were no traffic lights.

unit.utterance: k'ʷel admi can bikardel... ʡaˁb admi xunna baʔle, t'aškaʁible mašinte propuskat birq'ulde hetːi χalq' ciwilizacija heltːub
unit.utterance_translation: If two people meet, three people were on the side of the road, the cars stopped and let these people go, there was civilization there.

unit.utterance: wot.
unit.utterance_translation: Well...

unit.utterance: c'ili daˁrχaˁlla dučːi qiliw kelgunda nu hetːu... witulqanqːella Latwijalcːe aswalt'la but'a sitːa aswalt'ler habertːible čibaˁqibda het
unit.utterance_translation: Then I stayed there at a house, well, there, when I arrived in Latvia, pieces of asphalt and chewing gum flew up from the asphalt [= because I drove so fast, because the roads were good]; I hit on the road [= drove fast].

unit.utterance: D bukwala daglicːe, ul, daglicːe q'ut'čibitarq'ibda sala.
unit.utterance_translation: In the middle (of the plates) you put the letter D, in front.

unit.utterance: hetːu čiwitagurdaj t'ašaaʁibda calli alrah
unit.utterance_translation: Before arriving there, not even one (person) stopped me.
unit.add_comments: [DF: HM says that "čiwitagurdaj" is an Icari form, it should be "чивитегъий" in Sanzhi; the suffix "-daj" is probably not Sanzhi, but the verb stem should be Sanzhi.]

unit.utterance: cellij akːun latjšskij nomerte pod nix proexalsja helʁuna q'ʷila-q'ʷila ʡaˁmalte kam adirχʷi dila
unit.utterance_translation: Because the Latvian plate, I drove with it, like this without a little trick I cannot be.

unit.utterance: dučːi sajʁibqːella ʡurus xunulla qili xuradiχubda nušːa.
unit.utterance_translation: At night when I arrived at the house of a Russian woman, we slept there.

unit.utterance: polnoč saˁʡaˁt ca dičible dučːilla sajʁibcede du.
unit.utterance_translation: At midnight, at one o'сlock at night I arrived.

unit.utterance: mašin kabaturre hajʁi k'ʷi dičib
unit.utterance_translation: When I parked the car and entered the house it was already 2 o'clock.

unit.utterance: wagla qar amzu warq'ible wircible het xunulli du.
unit.utterance_translation: (She) cleaned my upper body, that woman washed me,

unit.utterance: waχːunne daˁrχaˁlla.
unit.utterance_translation: (she) made me dinner,

unit.utterance: kʷir warq'ibda.
unit.utterance_translation: and put me to bed.
unit.add_comments: DF: HM says that he would rather say "kʷir kajsaqunda" 'put to sleep, lay down'.

unit.utterance: čːaˁʡaˁlla saˁʡaˁt wec'nu cara dikaraj usːunne kelgunda du.
unit.utterance_translation: In the morning, I slept until 11.

unit.utterance: čisalhunqːella insan wakːʷi qiliw
unit.utterance_translation: When I woke up, there was nobody at home.

unit.utterance: lakkadarq'ible murhe led, celled čid, trilaˁžledčid.
unit.utterance_translation: The gold was lying around, everything was there on that what's-its-face, on the dressing table [i.e. all her jewelry was lying out in the open].

unit.utterance: c'il acːe bursille t'upːugle, qulexme lidil cik'al daqil lette.
unit.utterance_translation: Then, if I tell you, rings, bracelets, everything, many things were there.

unit.utterance: arc lette kadišːible heltːud
unit.utterance_translation: There was money, (money) was placed there.

unit.utterance: nu libil cinna leb dawla-mas leb lak'sakabarq'ible heltːusa.
unit.utterance_translation: Well, all of her (things) were there, (her) wealth was there, (her things) were thrown about there.

unit.utterance: helij qːaʁ iχubda, baˁħ iχubda čak'al wakːu qiliw ja guppaturre qal guražij bala, biʡaˁn hasːar ja cik'al
unit.utterance_translation: About this I lost my mind, I went crazy [because I couldn't believe people would just leave their stuff around and not lock their houses], nobody was at home; neither could I leave the house [like this], I would be sad if somebody stole something.

unit.utterance: meχ dakːu, cadaalra uncːala hitːi kaburqaˁnra bakːu qːapu ja tːurarka ja barklerka.
unit.utterance_translation: There was no lock. There wasn't even a lock in one door, neither from the outside nor from the inside.

unit.utterance: ca zunrašːu agurda, k'ʷiibil, ʡaˁbibil zunra rarčːibda.
unit.utterance_translation: I went to one neighbour, to the second, to the third neighbour, I found her.

unit.utterance: hačible čidažaqibda lidil heltːi, it urk' ruqun
unit.utterance_translation: I took her home and showed her everything. She was confused.

unit.utterance: hešːt... nišːala heštːub bilʡaˁn wakːu rik'ʷar.
unit.utterance_translation: "At our place no one steals," she said.

unit.utterance: uˁq'en rik'ʷar bahlal ala.
unit.utterance_translation: You can leave [go] without worry.

unit.utterance: na dul dila daˁʡla amzudex barčːij bahanne dila sowest očistit barq'ij bahandan hačibilde hetːu
unit.utterance_translation: Now to have a clean face, to clean my conscience, I brought her there.

unit.utterance: akːʷar xar qːuc aiči, ʡuˁnruleb dul hasːibil akːu urra cik'al.
unit.utterance_translation: Even if (nobody) was there, I did not touch it. In my life I have not taken anything that was not mine.

unit.utterance: helij urk'čiw uqunda.
unit.utterance_translation: And I was afraid about this.

unit.utterance: mašinala spičkala šːala pirχkabarq'ible lakkabarq'itːe p'ap'rus berčːiblehitːi.
unit.utterance_translation: Of a car [= road], having burnt a match, if you throw it down, having smoked a cigarette,

unit.utterance: gurhasːa bik'ulde satːibitulqante
unit.utterance_translation: "Pick it up!", the passers-by [lit. the ones who pass by] tell you,

unit.utterance: itːalaʁuna amzudex dul nalla čibažibil akːu.
unit.utterance_translation: A cleanness like theirs I have seen nowhere else.

unit.utterance: ciwilizacija, porjadok, ʡaˁħdex [CROSSTALK]
unit.utterance_translation: civilization, order, good

unit.utterance: helde, hel hel pepel p'aq'kabarq'itːera uberi bik'ulde hetːi.
unit.utterance_translation: If you let the ashes of your cigarette fall down, they said, "Take it off" (= clean it up).

unit.utterance: helʁuna amzudexla qːuʁace musːa tebde
unit.utterance_translation: There was such a clean, beautiful place.

unit.utterance: hettala bahlala bahlala porjadoklicːeb qːuʁace ʡaˁħkabicːur musːa het cab.
unit.utterance_translation: At their place, it was quiet, orderly, it was a beautiful, good place.

unit.utterance: bah wahice ʡaˁzirbažande.
unit.utterance_translation: The worst (place) was Azerbaijan.

unit.utterance: hextːub... naˁsdex... naˁsdexra χalq'la ʡaˁħdex... wahidexra
unit.utterance_translation: There it was dirty, dirty, and the people are bad.

unit.utterance: ajteʁib musːa belil akːu juldaš, har šaharricːe har Rassijala šaharricːe primerno čiwiteʁibilda du.
unit.utterance_translation: There is no place where I did not go. I went to every town in Russia, to every town.

unit.utterance: bikːan reket čibičib, bikːan heltːi qːalmaqːar t'amahama čidičib
unit.utterance_translation: And I ended up in a racket, and there were scandals and problems

unit.utterance: [INTERVIEWER TALK]
unit.utterance_translation: [INTERVIEWER TALK]

unit.utterance: ha hetil het kat' hilawa čariχuble tːurasaˁq'unne salaˁrk'a haberχːur pojemleb dila
unit.utterance_translation: Ah, he, this, when I came back (from Lativa), when I left, my fuel finished on a hill.

unit.utterance: uže čibigul zaprawka lebde agurre heltːurka badra salaˁrk'ala kaqːibda.
unit.utterance_translation: The petrol station was already visible. I went away from there carrying a bucket of fuel.

unit.utterance: bičːib, zad ja arc asasːib; cinna zaprawit barq'ibqːel batij arganne, rik'ul zaprawšica
unit.utterance_translation: They gave (me the bucket), they did not take money or anything (for the fuel in the bucket), the attendant (at the petrol station, a woman), said, "When you refuel, you will let it (i.e. leave the money, pay)."

unit.utterance: i srazu warxle wihač'ibda, znak lebde kabicːurre kirpič..
unit.utterance_translation: And I directly went to the petrol station through the stop sign (taking the wrong entry).

unit.utterance: pod kirpič wiagurre dila bakːʷarqːella haburχːul salaˁrk'a ahaberχːʷaqij
unit.utterance_translation: I drove to the petrol station where it was prohibited, to refuel because the fuel was out.

unit.utterance: hel tːura uq'aˁn, bik'ul šupirtal tːuraaʁibda helka aaturda zaprawit.
unit.utterance_translation: They said, "Drive away!" The other drivers threw me out, they did not let me refuel.

unit.utterance: calli bursib, k'ʷilli bursib c'il il zaprawšica rik'ʷar wabše k'at' akert'ulda rik'ʷar salaˁrk'a
unit.utterance_translation: One said (this), a second one, then the attendent says, "I'm not pouring even a drop of fuel."

unit.utterance: hej guruq'ij bakːu.
unit.utterance_translation: I cannot drive on (lit. it is not to go on).

unit.utterance: haburχːul biχʷar rik'ʷar carara badra bikat'ible čarsabarq'a χalq'li daˁʡle c'il bic'a.
unit.utterance_translation: "If (the fuel) finishes," said the attendent, "pour another bucket, and then drive here as other people and refuel!"

unit.utterance: hel barq'ij čibičib c'il uruc iχubda dul barq'ibillij du c'aχ kabicːur dam
unit.utterance_translation: Then I was embarrassed for what had happened, I felt ashamed for what I had done.

unit.utterance: ʁajčira uqunda, majmajčira uqunda heltːaj du winawatxar.
unit.utterance_translation: And I argued, I quarreled with them, though it was my fault.

unit.utterance: c'il izwinicara iχʷij čibičib heltːalla salaw qːuʁal poprasit barq'ibda čirkaderχːʷaja ik'ul.
unit.utterance_translation: Then I apologized in front of them, I asked them to forgive me.

unit.utterance: tːurakaʁible, čarsabarq'ible hačible qːuʁal bic'ible agurda dalše
unit.utterance_translation: I drove out, turned around, drove back, refueled normally and left.

unit.utterance: helʁuna dune tebde hetːi gde-to kːaʔc'anu ʡaˁbra-aʁʷraibil dusːicːeb ʡaˁbraibil dusde, aʁʷraibil dusdew hel.
unit.utterance_translation: There was a place like this, somewhere in the year 83 or 84 this happened.

unit.utterance: socijalizmade hetqːella, hetqːella hetqːella hetʁuna porjadok lebde hetːub
unit.utterance_translation: There was Socialism at that time, proper order (tidiness) like this was there at that time.

unit.utterance: Estonijala xarbeʁitːel ul hana admilcːe, taˁp uc'rante ʁuna χalq'de Estonijala.
unit.utterance_translation: About Estonia, if you ask somebody, the people there are exactly like the Icari people, the people who were there in Estonia.

unit.utterance: xarbeʁitːel admilcːe činarka heχtːu uˁq'ide
unit.utterance_translation: If you ask somebody there how to drive somewhere,

unit.utterance: du haʔible, dawaj sjadu, haʔible, wikajžible, du čikajʁaqible heχtːu rinokle heχ primerno w osnownom rinoklewde waxadi hetːu... c'il caw čikajžible abtabuzle.
unit.utterance_translation: They say, "I sit [in your car and show you the way]," and he sat down, and made me go; I went to the market (with the one who showed the way), when I was at the market, then he himself took the bus.

unit.utterance: hej iltːu kat' cellij kač'ibde?
unit.utterance_translation: "Why did you come with me?"

unit.utterance: a u ik'ʷar witiqutːe heštːuw šaharricːew abalχan šaharricːew.
unit.utterance_translation: "You," he said, "you would get lost here in a town that you do not know."

unit.utterance: a iχ latjšalla naoborotde, jara balk'unne čibursi, ja zad ahaʔible čarsabiχuble baši
unit.utterance_translation: And the Latvians, on the contrary, either told the wrong way, or did not say anything, turned around, and went away.

unit.utterance: ʡaˁsil burčːi hetːi ʁaj abik'ʷi hettal abursi.
unit.utterance_translation: They were probably angry with those who did not speak (their language), they did not tell (the way).

unit.utterance: a hextːi estoncabe ik'ulda dik'ardex akːʷar uc'rantaj miši kabicːur dam, čujnara agurda hetːu
unit.utterance_translation: But the Estonians, I think, are very similar to the Icari people, no difference, how often I went there.

unit.utterance: bučra bučːu acːella kabižible, qːuʁace iχtilatra birq'i, bek'licːe paˁqčikajk'ʷanxar ʁajra abik'ʷi.
unit.utterance_translation: As for drinking, they drink with you, they sit with you and have nice conversations, and although they do not shame you, they do not say a word.

unit.utterance: ʡaˁħ χalq'de.
unit.utterance_translation: [They] are good people.

unit.utterance: Estonijala χalq' ʡaˁħtede
unit.utterance_translation: The Estonian people were good.

unit.utterance: latjši wredni χalq'de, wahi χalq'de, no porjadok, amzudex χʷalle heχtːalla.
unit.utterance_translation: The Latvian were bad people, they were evil people, but order, cleanness is great among them.

unit.utterance: ciwilizacija, urowen kulturi qːuʁacede
unit.utterance_translation: Civilization, the cultural level, it was beautiful

unit.utterance: Moldowa xužede nišːalajarka daršnara.
unit.utterance_translation: Moldova was worse than ours, a hundred times.

unit.utterance: Moldawija hetːu agurilda
unit.utterance_translation: I went there to Moldova.

unit.utterance: bučːnira, naˁsra, amzudex akːʷira, bardakra krugom wahice, Moldawija ʡaˁzirbažanʁunade
unit.utterance_translation: And they drank, and it was dirty, and it was not clean, and everywhere around there was chaos, it was bad, Moldova was like Azerbaijan.

unit.utterance: nu Ukrajnalcew du χaχulde.
unit.utterance_translation: Well, in the Ukraine I was a khokhol (= a pejorative term for a Ukrainian).

unit.utterance: Ukrajnalcew du χaχulda ik'ud....
unit.utterance_translation: In the Ukraine, I was a khokhol, I say...
